item.title: Goodbye third-party apps! WhatsApp’s new scanner feature lets you scan and share documents like a pro - The Financial Express
item.description:
Scan and share documents directly in WhatsApp with its new scanner feature

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Financial Express

WhatsApp is rolling out a new feature that allows users to scan and share documents directly within the app, simplifying document sharing and potentially phasing out the need for third-party apps.

This feature is currently available for some users in the latest WhatsApp update (version 24.25.80) on iOS and will enhance the document sharing experience.

  • Users can open WhatsApp, select the sharing menu, and choose the document sharing option.
  • The camera feature allows for direct scanning of documents within the app.
  • Erase and edit scanned documents before sharing.
  • Options for cropping, adjusting contrast, and brightening scanned documents are included.
“The quality of the scan has been kept high in readability and clarity, making it suitable for professional use.”

In conclusion, this new feature is set to enhance both business and personal document sharing experiences on WhatsApp.

item.title: Xiaomi Pad 7 to launch in India on January 10: Here’s what the tablet may offer - The Times of India
item.description:
Xiaomi Pad 7 to Launch in India on January 10

Date: January 1, 2024
Source: Times of India

The Xiaomi Pad 7 is set to launch in India on January 10, 2024, with expectations of powerful features and functionality that could revolutionize the tablet market.

  • The tablet will likely feature high-performance hardware.
  • Expected improvements in battery life and display quality.
  • Potential for competitive pricing in the Indian market.
"The upcoming launch has stirred excitement among tech enthusiasts and potential buyers alike."

In conclusion, the Xiaomi Pad 7 is anticipated to make a significant impact on the Indian tablet market, appealing to both professionals and casual users.

item.title: Samsung launches ‘Sonic speed’ Hedgehog PRO Plus microSD cards - The Indian Express
item.description:
Samsung launches ‘Sonic speed’ Hedgehog PRO Plus microSD cards

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Samsung has launched Sonic-branded microSD cards, called Hedgehog PRO Plus, in anticipation of the movie “Sonic the Hedgehog 3”, scheduled to premiere on January 3. These cards are designed for durability and high performance.

  • Available in four capacities: 128 GB, 256 GB, 512 GB, and 1 TB.
  • Peak read and write speeds of 180 MB/s and 130 MB/s, respectively.
  • Each card features unique Sonic character designs and various pricing based on capacity.
  • Rugged design withstands drops of over 4.8 meters and is water-resistant.
  • Backed by a 10-year limited warranty.
“With the Sonic the Hedgehog PRO Plus microSD cards, we’re combining the franchise’s instantly recognizable characters with the speed and reliability of Samsung PRO Plus microSDs to give your gear the ultimate Sonic boost,” - Jim Kiczek, Vice President of Memory Marketing at Samsung Electronics America.

The new microSD cards are set to be available for purchase in early 2025, appealing to gamers and content creators.

item.title: Instagram tests showing users unseen Highlights: Report - The Hindu
item.description:
Instagram Tests New Feature to Show Unseen Highlights to Users

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: TechCrunch

Meta is testing a new Instagram feature that shows users their friends' Highlights they may have missed after watching their Stories. This feature aims to enhance user engagement by presenting unseen but recent Highlights at the end of the Story “tray.”

  • The feature is currently being tested on a small scale.
  • Highlights allow users to save media formats for long-term viewing at the top of their profile.
  • Instagram's Stories last for 24 hours unless saved as Highlights.
  • Recently, Instagram also introduced the ability to schedule DMs to be sent later.
Meta spokesperson stated, 'Unseen but recent Highlights would come to a user at the end of the Story “tray,” in case they had missed out on these updates previously.'

This new initiative by Instagram may aim to keep users more connected to their friends' activities and enrich the overall experience of the app.

item.title: Apple may launch new entry-level iPad in January 2025: What to expect - Business Standard
item.description:
Apple May Launch New Entry-Level iPad in January 2025: What to Expect

Last Updated: Dec 26 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Apple is expected to release its 11th generation iPad early in 2025, coinciding with the iPadOS 18.3 update, focusing on enhancing performance and introducing new features.

  • The iPad 11 model may come with the A17 Pro chip, enhancing its capabilities for AI features.
  • It might be the first Apple device to feature a new modem for Wi-Fi and 5G connectivity.
  • Other anticipated products include a new iPad Air, next-gen iPhone SE with A18 chip, M4 MacBook Air, and a second-gen AirTag.
"The anticipated iPad 11 generation model will come with iPadOS 18.3 pre-installed."

The upcoming iPad aims to provide significant performance boosts while retaining familiar aesthetics, signaling Apple's continuous innovation in its product lines.

item.title: WhatsApp for iOS Rolls Out New AR Effects and Backgrounds, Adds Option to Scan Documents - Gadgets 360
item.description:
WhatsApp for iOS Introduces New AR Effects and Document Scanning

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets 360

WhatsApp for iOS has rolled out a significant update featuring augmented reality (AR) effects and a document scanning capability to enhance user experience.

  • New AR effects can now be applied through the camera, including confetti, star windows, and more.
  • A document scanning feature allows users to scan and share documents directly in the app.
  • Filters such as color, grayscale, and black & white are available for scanned documents.
  • WhatsApp automatically crops scanned images and includes an auto-shutter option.
“Gadgets 360 staff members can confirm the availability of both of these features in the latest version of WhatsApp for iOS.”

This update marks an exciting development for WhatsApp users, enhancing both communication and file-sharing capabilities.

item.title: Tech recap 2024: Top five entry-level flagships from OnePlus, Apple, Google - Business Standard
item.description:
Tech Recap 2024: Top Five Entry-Level Flagships from OnePlus, Apple, Google

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Tech News

Entry-level flagship smartphones are offering impressive features at competitive prices. This article reviews the top five models for 2024.

  • Xiaomi 14: Premium design, compact form factor, and user-friendly camera system. Price: Rs 69,999.
  • iPhone 16: Improved software and imaging, priced at Rs 79,900. Lacks high-refresh-rate display.
  • OnePlus 12: Focuses on design and performance, priced at Rs 69,999 but lacks advanced AI features.
  • Samsung Galaxy S24: Strong contender with innovative tools, priced at Rs 79,999.
  • Google Pixel 9: Excellent AI integration with impressive display, priced at Rs 79,999.
"Entry-level flagship smartphones offer a value-for-money proposition, combining pro-grade features with affordability."

Overall, these smartphones provide great options for consumers looking for premium features at a lower cost.

item.title: iPhone 16 available with big discount but the deal is only for today - India Today
item.description:
iPhone 16 Available with a Big Discount but the Deal is Only for Today

Published On: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Nandini Yadav

If you have been waiting for a good deal to buy the new iPhone 16 then this could be the deal to consider. The iPhone 16 is selling at a discount of up to Rs 16,000.

  1. The deal is part of a Christmas Carnival sale by Apple’s exclusive retail seller Imagine, ending today.
  2. Original price of iPhone 16: Rs 79,900; discounted price: Rs 76,400 after Rs 3,500 off.
  3. Bank discounts (SBI, ICICI, Kotak): Additional Rs 4,000 off, bringing the price down to Rs 72,400.
  4. Potential trade-in/exchange discounts can reduce the price to around Rs 64,400.
  5. The iPhone 16 features a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR OLED display, A18 chipset, and dual-camera setup.

The iPhone 16 promises to be a standout phone with its modern features, catering to photography enthusiasts with its advanced camera capabilities and offering a compact design for easy handling.

item.title: The retro hobby that can help boost happiness levels - BBC.com
item.description:
The Retro Hobby That Can Help Boost Your Happiness (Say Scientists)

Published on: Not specified
Source: BBC News

On a cold day in November, hundreds flocked to an arena in Coventry for the Rubik's UK Championship, where contestants raced to solve puzzle cubes. The event saw participants from around the world and highlighted the growing popularity of speedcubing, which scientists claim can boost wellbeing.

  • 500 participants from various countries attended the Rubik's UK Championship.
  • Speedcubing has grown, with an estimated 412,000 participating globally since the 1980s.
  • 2023 sales of Rubik's Cube products reached $86.6 million, a 13.5% increase from 2022.
  • Scientists suggest speedcubing fosters social connections and cognitive challenges that can enhance happiness.
  • Speedcubing may trigger a 'flow' state, described as almost meditative and rewarding.
"Speedcubing offers a unique combination of cognitive challenge, social connection, and personal achievement that contributes to happiness." - Polina Beloborodova, University of Wisconsin-Madison

In conclusion, speedcubing may not only be an engaging pastime but also a meaningful pursuit that aligns with mental health benefits.

item.title: Redington plans a marketplace makeover with software, cloud | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Redington plans a marketplace makeover with software, cloud

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Redington Ltd, India’s largest distributor of consumer gadgets, is planning to transform from a pure-play distribution company into a marketplace platform, driven by growth in its software and cloud segments.

  • Redington’s focus will remain on distribution and logistics for the next few years.
  • The transition to a marketplace model will start from 2025.
  • The shift aligns with industry trends towards cloud and AI technologies.
“For the next few years, distribution and logistics will remain the mainstay...” - V.S. Hariharan, Group CEO

This strategic shift highlights Redington's adaptation to changing market dynamics and technological advancements.

item.title: For SRF, there’s no light at the end of tunnel yet | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
For SRF, there’s no light at the end of tunnel yet

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

The growth catalyst for SRF Ltd is absent in the December quarter following a weak performance in H1FY25, with a notable decline in revenue from its chemicals business.

  • Revenue from the chemicals sector, which made up 41% of H1 revenue, dropped by 8% year-on-year.
  • The segment is affected by a slowdown in the global agrochemical market and high inventory levels among customers.
  • Other contributing factors include weak exports of refrigerant gases and pricing pressure from cheaper agrochemical supplies from China.
“The segment continues to suffer from the global agrochemical market slowdown due to elevated inventory levels at customers' end.”

In summary, SRF Ltd is facing significant challenges in the chemicals market, indicating a tough outlook for the near term.

item.title: Box-office hits draw shoppers back to malls in December | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Box-office hits draw shoppers back to malls in December

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Mint

New Delhi: A string of blockbuster movies towards the end of 2024 has partly helped rescue shopping malls and retailers after a near washout earlier in the year, according to top industry executives.

  • Pushpa 2: The Rule starring Allu Arjun, one of the all-time top grossers, opened in cinemas in December.
  • Kartik Aaryan-starrer Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 and Mufasa: The Lion King have also drawn crowds.

As the holiday season approaches, these significant film releases contribute to increased foot traffic in shopping malls, providing a much-needed boost to retailers who experienced downturns earlier in the year.

item.title: GeForce Experience is dead – replaced by the Nvidia App – and good riddance - TechRadar
item.description:
GeForce Experience is dead – replaced by the Nvidia App – and good riddance

Date: Not specified Source: TechRadar

The article discusses the retirement of Nvidia's GeForce Experience in favor of the new Nvidia App, marking a drastic change that many users are celebrating.

  • GeForce Experience (GFE) was criticized for being convoluted and requiring user logins without offering value.
  • The new Nvidia App combines useful features from GFE and the outdated Nvidia Control Panel.
  • User feedback indicates significant improvements in usability and convenience with the new Nvidia App.
  • The Nvidia App does not require logins, removing the frustration associated with GFE.
  • Despite improvements, some areas still need enhancement for full integration of features.
"Nothing infuriated me more than GeForce Experience during that time."

This change signifies a positive step for Nvidia users, although concerns remain about potential future changes that may reintroduce unwelcome features.

item.title: Top 10 Mobile Phones to Watch Out for Next Year - Techstory
item.description:
Top 10 Mobile Phones Releasing Next Year

Date: December 2024 Source: TechStory

Next year promises to be a game-changer in smartphones, with top brands introducing cutting-edge technology, innovative designs, and features that redefine user experiences.

  • 1. Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max - Features include a periscope zoom lens, A18 Bionic chip, improved battery life, and titanium frame.
  • 2. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra - Expected to have a 200MP camera and Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset.
  • 3. Google Pixel 9 Pro - Focus on AI integration and computational photography improvements.
  • 4. OnePlus 13 Pro - High performance with Hasselblad camera partnership and 150W fast charging.
  • 5. Xiaomi 14 Ultra - Leica camera system and significant charging capabilities.
  • 6. Sony Xperia 1 VI - 4K OLED display and professional-grade camera features.
  • 7. Asus ROG Phone 8 - 165Hz AMOLED display, optimized for gaming.
  • 8. Oppo Find X7 Pro - Combines design elegance with innovation.
  • 9. Vivo X100 Pro+ - Advanced photography capabilities and gimbal stabilization technology.
  • 10. Honor Magic 6 - Focus on a unique display and advanced AI features.

These upcoming smartphones highlight a trend towards AI-driven features, sustainability in materials, and better connectivity through 5G and beyond, making 2025 an exciting year for tech enthusiasts.

Stay updated to grab the latest flagship and redefine your smartphone experience.

item.title: Redmi Turbo 4 to Get MediaTek Dimensity 8400-Ultra SoC; Realme Neo 7 SE With Dimensity 8400 Teased - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Redmi Turbo 4, Realme Neo 7 SE to Get MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Series SoCs

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Gadgets 360

The Redmi Turbo 4 will be the first smartphone featuring the MediaTek Dimensity 8400-Ultra chipset, launching in early 2025. Meanwhile, the Realme Neo 7 SE is also expected to use this processor, with its debut being teased by the company.

  • The Redmi Turbo 4 is confirmed to launch in China by early 2025.
  • It will be powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 8400-Ultra chipset.
  • The Realme Neo 7 SE will likely feature the same processor.
  • Dimensity 8400 features advanced generative AI capabilities and supports up to 320-megapixel camera sensors.
  • Smartphones with this SoC can achieve WQHD displays with 144Hz refresh rates.
"The latest MediaTek chipset claims to help capture more light and focus faster."

This collaboration between Redmi and Realme signifies a competitive advancement in smartphone technology, leveraging MediaTek's powerful new chipset for enhanced performance.

item.title: Belying expectations: Five tech letdowns of 2024 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Belying Expectations: Five Tech Letdowns of 2024

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mint

This article discusses the expectations surrounding generative AI technologies and the challenges faced by companies in implementing them effectively. Despite the hype, many enterprises are hesitant to adopt these tools at scale due to various hurdles.

  • Generative AI has great potential, but companies are approaching it cautiously.
  • Challenges include misinformation, biases, and high investment risks.
  • Successful scaling of AI solutions relies heavily on addressing these issues.
  • Many businesses remain in the testing phase instead of full deployment.
  • Specific models like ChatGPT and DALL-E 2 are being evaluated for practical utility.
“Most businesses remain cautious, testing these tools rather than deploying them at scale.”

The current state of generative AI reflects a cautious but hopeful approach from businesses, highlighting the need for careful consideration before widespread adoption.

item.title: Vivo Y29 5G launched in India with Military Grade durability: All you need to know - India TV News
item.description:
Vivo Y29 5G launched in India with Military Grade durability: All you need to know

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: India TV News

Vivo has unveiled the Vivo Y29 5G in India, a mid-range smartphone priced from Rs 13,999. It features military-grade durability with an IP64 rating for dust and splash resistance.

  • 6.68-inch LCD with 120Hz refresh rate and up to 1000 nits brightness.
  • 50MP AI Night Mode rear camera and 8MP front camera.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor and a 5500mAh battery.
  • Running on Funtouch OS 14 based on Android 14.
  • Available in four storage variants with prices starting at Rs 13,999.
“Vivo claims the battery retains 80% capacity over four years of usage.”

The Vivo Y29 5G offers robust features at an affordable price, making it a competitive option in the mid-range smartphone market.
